page.title: 13Overton & Fyfield Cottages.
page.content: A number of local cottages have thatched roofs. They should last for over twenty years, possibly up to a hundred years. Work on the thatches is carried out by a local thatcher from Lacock. The residents of the cottages like the pretty appearance of the thatched roofs above all else. They enjoy living in the pleasant countryside. The cottages date from the 16th and 17th centuries. They are built largely from sarsen stone foundations, flint and chalk. Some cottages are not thatched. One cottage is over 200 years old. The lady has lived there since she was seven. The house was haunted when she moved in. She keeps three canaries, two dogs and a cat.
